Trichodes lepidus
ab. revoili
Champenois, 1900
:
Holotype ɗ Somali ; Oursangueli; Revoil 1881 ( MNHN ). Further specimens:
1 specimen
, Egypt , aid.
Jan. 76
; ex coll. Janson ( MNHN ), location doubtful.
Head including eyes broader than apex of pronotum; finely punctate; with long, dark and short, white pubescence; antennae red, club dark (often only terminal segment).

Elytral ground color completely reduced (then blue), or orange to red ground color reduced to one (= ab. biguttatus
(Corporaal, 1948 ))
, two (= ab. bisbiguttatus
(Corporaal, 1948 ))
or three (= ab. revoili
(Champenois, 1900 ))
spots; the remaining fasciae blue, purple or green; apical spot of ground color mostly reaching the lateral margin, but not the suture; sometimes reduced to a narrow dash.
Legs orange to yellow­brown; hind tibiae curved; pubescence on lower surface white, with dark hairs on upper surface.
Ventral surface green, abdomen orange to yellow; thorax with dense, white pubescence, abdomen with sparse pubescence.
Aedeagus, pygidium and male sternum VIII, see figs. 16–19 .
